columns.text: The problem will require us to compute the maximum increase in sales for Alexander Co.

### Let's first provide the given data in the problem.

* Assets and costs are proportional to sales.
* The company maintains a constant 40% dividend payout ratio.
* The company maintains a constant debt-equity ratio.

## Requirement.

### Compute the maximum increase in sales that can be sustained assuming there is no new equity.

The maximum increase in sales that can be sustained by assuming no equity issuance is calculated by computing the sustainable growth rate.

### Let's first define what a sustainable growth rate is.

**Sustainable Growth Rate** - The growth without external support and financing maintains a constant debt-equity ratio.

### Define ROE (return on equity) of the company.

**Return on Equity** - This is the return on net assets of the company. ROE calculation is a measurement of the financial performance of the company.

### Determine the ROE (return on equity).

The return on equity is calculated by dividing the net income by the total equity.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Return on Equity}&= \dfrac{\text{Net Income}}{\text{Total Equity}}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{\$5,621.00}{\$48,800.00}\\[15pt]
&= 0.1152 \times 100\\[15pt]
&= \boxed{\textbf{11.52\%}}
\end{aligned}
$$
Therefore, the return on equity is **$11.52%**.

### Compute the retention ratio or the plow back ratio.

The retention ratio/plow back ratio is used to measure how much of the net income after the declared dividends are retained.
$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Retention Ratio}&= \dfrac{\text{Retained Earnings}}{\text{Net Income}}\\[15pt]


\end{aligned}
$$

### Compute the retained earnings.

The retained earnings are calculated by deducting the declared dividends from the net income.
$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\textbf{Description}&\underline{\textbf{Amount}}\\[10pt]
\text{Net Income}&\$5,621.00\\
\text{Less: Declared Dividends}&\underline{(2,248.40)}\\
\text{Retained Earnings}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$3,372.60}}}\\


\end{array}
$$

Therefore, the retained earnings are **$3,372.60**.

### Now that the retained earnings are available, we can compute the retention ratio.

The retained earnings will be used in calculating the retention ratio.
$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Retention Ratio}&= \dfrac{\text{Retained Earnings}}{\text{Net Income}}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{\$3,372.60}{\$5,621.00}\\[15pt]
&= 0.6 \times 100\\[15pt]
&= \boxed{\textbf{60\%}}


\end{aligned}
$$

Therefore, the retention ratio is **60%**.

### Compute the sustainable growth rate.

Now that the retention ratio and the return on equity are available, we can compute the sustainable growth rate.

**Terms:**
**ROE** - Return on equity
**b** - Retention ration / plowback ratio


$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Sustainable Growth Rate}&= \dfrac{\text{ROE $\times$ b}}{\text{1 - ROE $\times$ b}}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{11.52\% \times 60\%}{1 - 11.52\% \times 60\%}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{0.0691}{1 - 0.0691}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{0.0691}{0.9309}\\[15pt]
&= 0.0742 \times 100\\[15pt]
&= \boxed{\textbf{7.42\%}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Therefore, the sustainable growth rate is **7.42%**.
In this exercise, we are to determine the maximum increase in sales attainable by the company.

## Sustainable Growth Rate
\
The sustainable growth rate is referred to as the maximum rate of growth attainable by the company without the need for external equity financing and at the same time, maintaining the debt-to-equity at a constant ratio.

The sustainable growth rate is the maximum rate of growth that a company would attain which requires the firm not to increase the company equity. While the ROE is the ratio of the net income and the equity.
\
Therefore, the sustainable growth rate is directly proportional to the ROE indicating that as the ROE increases, the sustainable growth rate increases and as the ROE decreases, the sustainable growth rate decreases as well.

## Accounting Return on Equity
\
Accounting Return on Equity is referred to as the financial measure of the company's financial performance. The ROE is computed by dividing the net income of the company by the total equity.

## Retention Ratio
\
The retention ratio is referred to as the rate of the net income that is included in the retained earnings and is used to grow the business.

In this exercise, the maximum increase in sales that is attainable by the company is referred to as the sustainable growth rate. Therefore, we are to determine the sustainable growth rate of the company.

Now, let us determine the sustainable growth rate using the following given:
 

<center>

|Given||
|:--|--:|
|Income Statement||
|$\hspace{20pt}$Sales|\$42,800|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Cost|\$35,500|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Net Income|\$7,300|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Taxes (23\%)|\$1,679|
|$\hspace{30pt}$Net Income|\$5,621|
|Balance Sheet||
|$\hspace{20pt}$ Current Assets|\$17,500|
|$\hspace{20pt}$ Fixed Assets|\$63,800|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Debt|\$37,000|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Equity|\$48,800|

Now, let us compute the sustainable growth rate:
 
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Sustainable Growth Rate}&=\frac{\text{ROE} \times b}{1-\text{ROE}\times b}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\frac{0.115\times 60\%}{1-0.115\times 60\%}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\frac{0.069}{1-0.069}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\frac{0.069}{0.931}\times 100\\[12pt]
&={0.0741}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\boxed{7.41\%}\\
\end{aligned}$$
 
**The sustainable growth rate of the company is 7.41\%. This ratio is the maximum increase in sales that is attainable by the company with no-issuance of new equity.**
